hours_text:
# Hours & Admission

* * *

**Winter Hours  
** _October 1 - April 30_

Wednesday – Saturday: 10am - 5pm  
Sunday: 1pm - 5pm Monday - Tuesday: Closed

**Summer Hours  
** _May 1 - September 30_

Tuesday - Saturday: 10am - 5pm  
Sunday: 1pm - 5pm Monday: Closed

_The museum is closed on:_

  * _Easter Sunday_

  *  _July 4th_

  *  _Thanksgiving day and day after_

  *  _Christmas Eve and Christmas Day_

  *  _New Years Eve and New Years Day_

* * *

#### **Museum General Admission**

  * Adults — $14 

_Admission fee includes a 2-day pass for adults ages 18 and above. Please note that a sales tax will be added to the admission rates seen above._

  * Seniors and Military — $12 

Admission fee includes a 2-day pass for military and seniors ages 62 and above. Please note that a sales tax will be added to the admission rates seen above.

  * Youth — $9 

Admission fee includes 2-day pass for students ages 6–17. Please note that a sales tax will be added to the admission rates seen above.

  * Children — Free 

Children ages 5 & under are free with family. Enjoy the Journey!

#### **Groups**

  * Group Rate — $9 per person 

Groups of 15 or more can call us at (605) 394-6923 one week prior to your visit for scheduling. Please note that a sales tax will be added to the admission rates seen above. We look forward to hosting your group! 

#### **Educational Groups**

  * Students — $5 

Educational groups with students ages 18 and under require chaperones (special pricing extended t...

collections_text:
Step through our doors and embark on a journey through 2 billion years of history—connecting you with the people, cultures, and science behind the ancient Black Hills and prairies of Western South Dakota. It’s a journey rich with stories and traditions—from prehistoric encounters and Native American heritage to pioneer tales and spaceflight. 

Each member of the family will delight in discovering a vast array of cultural artifacts and interactive experiences and leave with a connection to this unique and diverse place Lakotas fittingly called the “Island in the Plains.”

[ DISCOVER THE JOURNEY ](/the-journey)

  * ## Call for New Board Members 

As we move into an important period of growth and strategic planning, we’re looking for individuals who care deeply about education, culture, and our community to join us in shaping the Museum’s future.

[ Learn More ](/s/Journey-Museum-Board-Recruitment-Press-Release-11-10-25.pdf)

  * ## Journey Museum Annual Report

This Annual Report celebrates our progress and successes over the last year. 2024 marked the start of an exciting new era for the museum and we are excited to share our journey with you. 

[ View Report ](/s/Jouney-Museum-Annual-Report-2025-Optimized-adc8.pdf)

  * ## Join our Community

Join a community that cherishes the rich culture, history, and natural beauty of the Black Hills of South Dakota. Membership offers you unlimited access to our exhibits and discounts on events and programs.

[ Become a Member ](/members...
